message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class BenefieldProgram4 {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.println("Enter 5 Grades:");
        System.out.println("");
        double a, b, c, d, e; // 5 Grades
        double sum = 0; // total
        double avg; // percentage
        double min = 1; // lowest grade
        double max = 100; // highest grade

        // Calculations
        a = keyboard.nextDouble();
        b = keyboard.nextDouble();
        c = keyboard.nextDouble();
        d = keyboard.nextDouble();
        e = keyboard.nextDouble();
        keyboard.close();

        sum = (a + b + c + d + e);
        System.out.println("Total Score=:" + sum);
        avg = (a + b + c + d + e) / 500;
        System.out.println("Percentage =: " + avg);
        max = Double.MAX_VALUE;
        System.out.println("Highest Score= " + max);
        min = Double.MIN_VALUE;
        System.out.println("Lowest Score= " + min);
        if (avg >= 90)
            System.out.println("Grade= A");
        else if (avg >= 80)
            System.out.println("Grade= B");
        else if (avg >= 70)
            System.out.println("Grade= C");
        else if (avg >= 60)
            System.out.println("Grade= D");
        else
            System.out.println("Grade= F");

        try {
            FileWriter fileWriter = new FileWriter("output.txt");
            PrintWriter printWriter = new PrintWriter(fileWriter);
            printWriter.println("Total Score=:" + sum);
            printWriter.println("Percentage =: " + avg);
            printWriter.println("Highest Score= " + max);
            printWriter.println("Lowest Score= " + min);
            printWriter.close();
        } catch (IOException e1) {
            e1.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code provided calculates the total, percentage, highest, lowest, and grade based on the inputted grades. Additionally, it writes the results to an output.txt file using a FileWriter and PrintWriter. The output.txt file will contain the same information that is printed to the console.

            max = b;
        }

            max = c;
        }
        if (d > max) {
            max = d;
        }
        if (e > max) {
            max = e;
        }

            grade = "A";
        } else if (avg >= 80) {

            grade = "C";

            grade = "F";

<<<explanation>>>: In this code, I have added the necessary code to calculate the lowest score, highest score, and grade. I have also added code to write the output to a txt file using PrintWriter. The output file will contain the total score, percentage, lowest score, highest score, and grade.

<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class BenefieldProgram4 {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.println("Enter 5 Grades:");
        System.out.println("");
        double a, b, c, d, e; // 5 Grades
        double sum = 0; // total
        double avg; // percentage
        double min = 100; // lowest grade
        double max = 0; // highest grade

        // Calculations
        a = keyboard.nextDouble();
        b = keyboard.nextDouble();
        c = keyboard.nextDouble();
        d = keyboard.nextDouble();
        e = keyboard.nextDouble();
        keyboard.close();

        sum = a + b + c + d + e;
        avg = sum / 5;
        max = Math.max(Math.max(Math.max(Math.max(a, b), c), d), e);
        min = Math.min(Math.min(Math.min(Math.min(a, b), c), d), e);

        System.out.println("Total Score=:" + sum);
        System.out.println("Percentage =: " + avg);
        System.out.println("Highest Score= " + max);
        System.out.println("Lowest Score= " + min);

        try {
            FileWriter fileWriter = new FileWriter("output.txt");
            PrintWriter printWriter = new PrintWriter(fileWriter);
            printWriter.println("Total Score: " + sum);
            printWriter.println("Percentage: " + avg);
            printWriter.println("Highest Score: " + max);
            printWriter.println("Lowest Score: " + min);
            if (avg >= 90)
                printWriter.println("Grade: A");
            else if (avg >= 80)
                printWriter.println("Grade: B");
            else if (avg >= 70)
                printWriter.println("Grade: C");
            else if (avg >= 60)
                printWriter.println("Grade: D");
            else
                printWriter.println("Grade: F");
            printWriter.close();
        } catch (IOException e1) {
            e1.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code has been modified to calculate the total, percentage, highest, lowest, and grade. The FileWriter and PrintWriter classes are used to write the output to a text file named "output.txt". The maximum and minimum values are calculated using the Math.max and Math.min functions respectively. The grades and other information are then printed to the console and written to the text file.

<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class BenefieldProgram4 {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.println("Enter 5 Grades:");
        System.out.println("");
        
        double a, b, c, d, e; //5 Grades
        double sum = 0;     // total
        double avg;        // percentage
        double min = 1;    // lowest grade
        double max = 100;  // highest grade
        
        //Calculations
        a = keyboard.nextDouble();
        b = keyboard.nextDouble();
        c = keyboard.nextDouble();
        d = keyboard.nextDouble();
        e = keyboard.nextDouble();
        keyboard.close();
        
        sum = (a+b+c+d+e);
        System.out.println("Total Score=:"+sum);
        avg =(a+b+c+d+e)/500;
        System.out.println("Percentage =: "+avg);
        max = Math.max(Math.max(Math.max(Math.max(a, b), c), d), e);
        System.out.println("Highest Score= " +max);
        min = Math.min(Math.min(Math.min(Math.min(a, b), c), d), e);
        System.out.println("Lowest Score= " +min);
        
        String grade;
        if (avg >= 90)
            grade = "A";
        else if (avg >=80)
            grade = "B";
        else if (avg >= 70)
            grade = "C";
        else if (avg >= 60)
            grade = "D";
        else
            grade = "F";
        System.out.println("Grade= " + grade);
        
        try {
            FileWriter fileWriter = new FileWriter("output.txt");
            PrintWriter printWriter = new PrintWriter(fileWriter);
            
            printWriter.println("Total Score: " + sum);
            printWriter.println("Percentage: " + avg);
            printWriter.println("Highest Score: " + max);
            printWriter.println("Lowest Score: " + min);
            printWriter.println("Grade: " + grade);
            
            printWriter.close();
        } catch (IOException e1) {
            e1.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code calculates the total, percentage, highest, lowest, and grade based on the input scores. It then writes these values to a text file named "output.txt" using a PrintWriter.

<<<code>>>: import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class BenefieldProgram4 {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.println("Enter 5 Grades:");
        System.out.println("");
        double a, b, c, d, e; // 5 Grades
        double sum = 0; // total
        double avg; // percentage
        double min = 100; // lowest grade
        double max = 0; // highest grade

        // Calculations
        a = keyboard.nextDouble();
        b = keyboard.nextDouble();
        c = keyboard.nextDouble();
        d = keyboard.nextDouble();
        e = keyboard.nextDouble();
        keyboard.close();

        sum = (a + b + c + d + e);
        System.out.println("Total Score=:" + sum);

        avg = (a + b + c + d + e) / 5;
        System.out.println("Percentage =: " + avg);

        if (a > max) {
            max = a;
        }
        if (b > max) {
            max = b;
        }
        if (c > max) {
            max = c;
        }
        if (d > max) {
            max = d;
        }
        if (e > max) {
            max = e;
        }
        System.out.println("Highest Score= " + max);

        if (a < min) {
            min = a;
        }
        if (b < min) {
            min = b;
        }
        if (c < min) {
            min = c;
        }
        if (d < min) {
            min = d;
        }
        if (e < min) {
            min = e;
        }
        System.out.println("Lowest Score= " + min);

        if (avg >= 90)
            System.out.println("Grade= A");
        else if (avg >= 80)
            System.out.println("Grade= B");
        else if (avg >= 70)
            System.out.println("Grade= C");
        else if (avg >= 60)
            System.out.println("Grade= D");
        else
            System.out.println("Grade= F");

        try {
            FileWriter fileWriter = new FileWriter("output.txt");
            PrintWriter printWriter = new PrintWriter(fileWriter);
            printWriter.println("Total Score: " + sum);
            printWriter.println("Percentage: " + avg);
            printWriter.println("Highest Score: " + max);
            printWriter.println("Lowest Score: " + min);
            printWriter.println("Grade: " + getGrade(avg));
            printWriter.close();
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }

    public static String getGrade(double avg) {
        if (avg >= 90)
            return "A";
        else if (avg >= 80)
            return "B";
        else if (avg >= 70)
            return "C";
        else if (avg >= 60)
            return "D";
        else
            return "F";
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code has been modified to include writing the output to a text file. It creates a FileWriter and a PrintWriter to write the output to the file. The output includes the total score, percentage, highest score, lowest score, and grade. The getGrade method is added to determine the grade based on the average score.

<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class BenefieldProgram4 {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.println("Enter 5 Grades:");
        double[] grades = new double[5];
        for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
            grades[i] = keyboard.nextDouble();
        }
        keyboard.close();

        double sum = 0;
        double min = Double.MAX_VALUE;
        double max = Double.MIN_VALUE;
        for (double grade : grades) {
            sum += grade;
            if (grade < min) {
                min = grade;
            }
            if (grade > max) {
                max = grade;
            }
        }

        double avg = sum / 5;
        System.out.println("Total Score = " + sum);
        System.out.println("Percentage = " + avg);
        System.out.println("Highest Score = " + max);
        System.out.println("Lowest Score = " + min);

        String grade;
        if (avg >= 90) {
            grade = "A";
        } else if (avg >= 80) {
            grade = "B";
        } else if (avg >= 70) {
            grade = "C";
        } else if (avg >= 60) {
            grade = "D";
        } else {
            grade = "F";
        }
        System.out.println("Grade = " + grade);

        try {
            FileWriter fileWriter = new FileWriter("output.txt");
            PrintWriter printWriter = new PrintWriter(fileWriter);
            printWriter.println("Total Score = " + sum);
            printWriter.println("Percentage = " + avg);
            printWriter.println("Highest Score = " + max);
            printWriter.println("Lowest Score = " + min);
            printWriter.println("Grade = " + grade);
            printWriter.close();
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this solution, I added an array to store the 5 grades entered by the user. Then, I used a loop to calculate the sum, minimum, and maximum grades. After that, I calculated the average grade and determined the letter grade based on the average. Finally, I used a FileWriter and PrintWriter to write the output to a text file named "output.txt".

<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class BenefieldProgram4 {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.println("Enter 5 Grades:");
        double a, b, c, d, e; // 5 Grades
        double sum = 0; // total
        double avg; // percentage
        double min = Double.MAX_VALUE; // lowest grade
        double max = Double.MIN_VALUE; // highest grade

        // Input grades
        a = keyboard.nextDouble();
        b = keyboard.nextDouble();
        c = keyboard.nextDouble();
        d = keyboard.nextDouble();
        e = keyboard.nextDouble();
        keyboard.close();

        // Calculate total score
        sum = a + b + c + d + e;
        System.out.println("Total Score = " + sum);

        // Calculate percentage
        avg = (sum / 500) * 100;
        System.out.println("Percentage = " + avg);

        // Find highest and lowest score
        if (a > max) {
            max = a;
        }
        if (b > max) {
            max = b;
        }
        if (c > max) {
            max = c;
        }
        if (d > max) {
            max = d;
        }
        if (e > max) {
            max = e;
        }

        if (a < min) {
            min = a;
        }
        if (b < min) {
            min = b;
        }
        if (c < min) {
            min = c;
        }
        if (d < min) {
            min = d;
        }
        if (e < min) {
            min = e;
        }

        System.out.println("Highest Score = " + max);
        System.out.println("Lowest Score = " + min);

        // Calculate grade
        String grade = "";
        if (avg >= 90) {
            grade = "A";
        } else if (avg >= 80) {
            grade = "B";
        } else if (avg >= 70) {
            grade = "C";
        } else if (avg >= 60) {
            grade = "D";
        } else {
            grade = "F";
        }
        System.out.println("Grade = " + grade);

        // Write results to file
        try {
            FileWriter fileWriter = new FileWriter("output.txt");
            PrintWriter printWriter = new PrintWriter(fileWriter);
            printWriter.println("Total Score = " + sum);
            printWriter.println("Percentage = " + avg);
            printWriter.println("Highest Score = " + max);
            printWriter.println("Lowest Score = " + min);
            printWriter.println("Grade = " + grade);
            printWriter.close();
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code has been modified to include the calculation of the highest score, lowest score, and grade. It also writes the results to a text file named "output.txt" using PrintWriter.
